Each week, Ticket Central offers discounted tickets to Broadway and Off-Broadway shows, sports games, and other NYC events. View the full list            ...and much more!                  Never pay full price for a movie again! Save up to $5 per ticket by using Ticket Central's movie passes. Read More                    Ticket Central can help you purchase group tickets to virtually any event in the NYC area! Read More                    Check out our Discount Finder for insider deals, discounts and tips for scoring tickets on the cheap for events in the NYC area Read More                    Reach over 32,000 NYU students, staff, faculty and alumni via email and social media Read More                                           For the most up-to-date deals, discounts and freebies, follow us on Facebook and Twitter !             NYU Card Information   Your valid NYUCard or Alumni ID is required for all transactions and services at NYU Ticket Central.   Only NYUCard holders with full university privileges (dark purple ID color) and Alumni with valid Alumni ID may purchase tickets to theatre, performing arts, sports and other special events, or claim free tickets to shows or movies on the first day of sale or distribution.   Please note that certain offers and deals are only available with an active NYU Home account.   Learn more about NYUCard »                           Mailing List   With so much going on at NYU Ticket Central, the best way to keep informed of our specials, discounts, bargains and give-aways is to join our email listserv!     How to join:   You can enter your email address here and you will be added to the listserv automatically.                                                Email:           Please check your spelling and hit submit only once!                          Submit                          Contact Us   Box Office Location:  566 LaGuardia Place  (Side entrance of the Kimmel Center)   Phone: 212.998.4941  Fax: 212.995.4961  Email: boxoffice@nyu.edu   Fall/Spring Hours:   Tuesday – Saturday,  noon–6:00pm   Closed on University holidays and breaks                                            NYU Footer          Search      Directory      Campus Map      Events      Contact Us      Site Map      Copyright and Fair Use      Feedback         Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University. Student Discounts and Rush Tickets: Many arts organizations provide discounts to students with valid ID. In some cases, the discount is only given to full time students or students under a certain age - so make sure to read the fine print. Rush tickets usually need to be purchased the day of the performance at a certain time. Not all organizations provide student discounts and rush tickets.     Email Lists and Coupon Codes: Some art organizations offer patrons coupon codes via their email lists. These codes usually can be used to purchase discounted tickets online, over the phone, or at the box office. Studies                 Programs       Undergraduate    Master's    Graduate Dual Degree    Advanced Certificate    Doctoral    Summer         Classical Voice Intensive     More Summer Programs           Study Abroad         Curriculum       Undergraduate    Master's    Dual Master's / Advanced Certificate        Auditions   People       Faculty    Students    Alumni        Ensembles   FAQ    Media                    Welcome to Classical Voice and Opera Studies                     Featured Video       Bill Wesbrooks and students discuss the Vocal programs             News       Professor William Wesbrooks on His New Book, Dramatic Circumstances    2011 Grammy Nominee Chandrika Tandon performed with the NYU Vocal Performance Chorale    Faculty member Brian Gill receives prestigious Van L. Lawrence Fellowship       Selected Events       Summer Classical Voice Intensive       Featured Students       Read about our current students              The Steinhardt School’s program in Vocal Performance offers classical singers the opportunity to study in the finest of performance settings. Our training is designed to prepare young singers for professional careers in recital and concert performance as well as opera. Our goal is that each singer leave our program with a solid foundation of healthy vocal technique combined with the freedom of musical and dramatic expression. Upon this foundation, graduates of this program have built successful careers in the world of opera, music theatre and popular music.    The Classical Voice curriculum requires extensive training in private voice, acting, diction for singers, song repertoire, and movement as well as the core courses for the serious study of music: music theory, aural comprehension, keyboard skills, and music history. Students in Vocal Performance have the opportunity to perform in fully-staged productions under the guidance of professional directors, musical directors, conductors, composers, choreographers, and designers.    Our voice faculty is drawn from New York’s top professional singers: a community of working professionals from the worlds of opera, recital and concert singing, and music theatre. In addition to their strong commitment to teaching, our faculty members pursue active professional careers. Their knowledge combined with their active performance experience helps to create a unique learning opportunity for each student.    The Department's acclaimed programs of study in Music Business (B.M., M.A.), Music Technology (B.M., M.M., Ph.D.), Jazz (B.M., M.M., Ph.D.), Music Composition (B.M., M.M., Ph.D.), and Music Education (B.M., M.A., Ph.D.) provide a rich and valuable array of elective courses for music performance majors that prepare them for an ever-changing music industry and musical climate. Undergraduate and graduate students also benefit from the extraordinary opportunities available through the diverse offerings of a major university in the cultural capital of the world, New York City.    B.M., M.M., Ph.D. in Music Performance William Wesbrooks, Director of Vocal Performance Telephone: 212 998 5154 Undergraduate Inquiries: Email Professor Dianna Heldman dh24@nyu.edu Graduate Inquiries: Email Professor William Wesbrooks www2@nyu.edu                                               Department of Music and Performing Arts Professions - 35 W. 4th Street, Suite 1077 -  New York, NY 10012 -  212 998 5424    This site, and all its contents, are Copyright ©    by New York University. All rights reserved.
